00020 #ifndef AGG_GAMMA_SPLINE_INCLUDED
00021 #define AGG_GAMMA_SPLINE_INCLUDED
00022 
00023 #include "agg_basics.h"
00024 #include "agg_bspline.h"
00025 
00026 namespace agg
00027 {
00028     
00029     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00030     // Class-helper for calculation gamma-correction arrays. A gamma-correction
00031     // array is an array of 256 unsigned chars that determine the actual values 
00032     // of Anti-Aliasing for each pixel coverage value from 0 to 255. If all the 
00033     // values in the array are equal to its index, i.e. 0,1,2,3,... there's
00034     // no gamma-correction. Class agg::polyfill allows you to use custom 
00035     // gamma-correction arrays. You can calculate it using any approach, and
00036     // class gamma_spline allows you to calculate almost any reasonable shape 
00037     // of the gamma-curve with using only 4 values - kx1, ky1, kx2, ky2.
00038     // 
00039     //                                      kx2
00040     //        +----------------------------------+
00041     //        |                 |        |    .  | 
00042     //        |                 |        | .     | ky2
00043     //        |                 |       .  ------|
00044     //        |                 |    .           |
00045     //        |                 | .              |
00046     //        |----------------.|----------------|
00047     //        |             .   |                |
00048     //        |          .      |                |
00049     //        |-------.         |                |
00050     //    ky1 |    .   |        |                |
00051     //        | .      |        |                |
00052     //        +----------------------------------+
00053     //            kx1
00054     // 
00055     // Each value can be in range [0...2]. Value 1.0 means one quarter of the
00056     // bounding rectangle. Function set_values() calculates the curve by these
00057     // 4 values. After calling it one can get the gamma-array with call 
00058     // get_gamma(). 
00059     // Class also supports the vertex source interface, i.e reset_iterator() and
00060     // next_vertex(). It's made for convinience and used in class gamma_ctrl. 
00061     // Before calling reset_iterator/next_vertex one must set the bounding box
00062     // set_box() using pixel coordinates. 
00063     //------------------------------------------------------------------------
00064 
00065     class gamma_spline
00066     {
00067     public:
00068         gamma_spline();
00069 
00070         void set_values(double kx1, double ky1, double kx2, double ky2);
00071         const unsigned char* get_gamma() const { return m_gamma; }
00072         double get_y(double x) const;
00073         void get_values(double* kx1, double* ky1, double* kx2, double* ky2) const;
00074         void set_box(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2);
00075 
00076         void       reset_iterator(unsigned);
00077         pathflag_e next_vertex(double* x, double* y);
00078 
00079     private:
00080         unsigned char m_gamma[256];
00081         double        m_x[4];
00082         double        m_y[4];
00083         bspline       m_spline;
00084         double        m_x1;
00085         double        m_y1;
00086         double        m_x2;
00087         double        m_y2;
00088         double        m_cur_x;
00089     };
00090 
00091 
00092 
00093 
00094 }
00095 
00096 #endif
